zone.line: five years had lived perfectly alone on an
estate, that had descended to her through
her mother, on the shores of Loch Lomond
in Scotland. My father had expressed a
wish in his letters that she should reside
with me at his family mansion which
was situated in a beautiful country near
Richmond in Yorkshire. She would not
consent to this proposition, but as soon as
she had arranged the affairs which her
brother’s departure had caused to fall to her
care, she quitted England and took me
with her to her scotch estate.
The care of me while a baby, and
afterwards untill I had reached my eit
eighth year devolved on a servant of
my mother’s, who had accompanied us
in our retirement for that purpose.
I was placed in a remote part of the
house, and only visited saw my aunt
at stated hours. These occurred twice
a day; once about noon she came to
my nursery, and once after her dinner
